content.description: Tricky at bolt 2 and a bit steeper toward the end.  Fun Climbing and a good warmup.  Becoming popular.
content.location: Rightmost of the two 5.10's on the front of the Cigar.

content.description: Bullet hard stone with perfect little water sculpted pockets.  As the route gets steeper you are forced right to gain more good features and some tiny crimps near the lip.
content.location: Begin in the center of the formation and follow a faint crack up and right.

content.description: Trickier than you may expect though it eases as you go up.  Great rock and fun climbing.  Nice job Meg!
content.location: Located on the slabby wall behind the Cigar pillar.  Start basically at the high point.

climbs.name: Have You Heard About the Sellout

content.description: Rambly start up a slabby beginning with jugs.  Mount the pillar and pull interesting holds to reach the big light-colored scar.  A slopey and devious crux leads to a reasonable finish.  Nice one JB!  Maybe the best of the four on the front of the pillar.
content.location: On the front of the Cigar Pillar on the left side.  Of the two 5.11's this is the right line and easier of the two.

content.description: Start same as Name of the Game and go left to gain the abundantly pocketed stripe.  As the pockets peter out, you'll find three separate cruxes to test your strength and reach.
content.protection: bolts and a clip and lower anchor
content.location: Begin in the center of backside of the pillar.  Clip one bolt then go left to a big side pull for the second clip.  The route goes straight up from there

content.description: Start with the large pocket on the lip and pull small features to get on the face.  Head for the arete and pull great pockets until you are forced left back onto the face.  Make a tough move to gain an obvious ledge, then execute a tough boulder problem to turn the lip.  Great position, very photogenic, fun.
content.protection: bolts and a clip and lower anchor
content.location: The rightmost route on the inside wall of the pillar.  Follows the right arete most of the way

content.description: After a very difficult entry fee, get a quick shake at a jug and pick your way up this devious gem.  Harder than it looks.
content.location: Leftmost route on the backside of the Cigar.  Shoot up the scooped face to gain the arete, follow that to the summit

content.description: Ramble up the easy low angle start to reach a sweet pockety head wall. Good climbing and a fine warm up for the area.
content.location: On the front of the Cigar. 2nd from the right. The left of Charlie's two 5.10's and the easier of the pair.

climbs.name: Could Be Made Into A Monster

content.description: Rambles up the face on decent holds.  A reachy crux awaits before the chains.  Good climbing
content.location: The Leftmost of the routes on the front of the Cigar and just right of Gravy Train.
